metadata.title: CVE-2017-17505 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In HDF5 1.10.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference in the functionH5O_pline_decode in the H5Opline.c file in libhdf5.a. For example, h5dumpwould crash when someone opens a crafted hdf5 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1
hdf5-tools - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1
libhdf5-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1
libhdf5-cpp-11 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1
libhdf5-mpich-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1
libhdf5-openmpi-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm1').
